column5: Those are great tips, especially location and jigging. I'll be trying my new Kamooki Smart Fish acquisitions this weekend so was looking for advice. Just got them by mail... They look deadly. Anyone got tips for that particular lure, I would love to see them. I expect things will be a little different this time!  Suggestions?  For anyone who hasn't seen it, have a peek and post your thoughts. I will report back here with my results.  http://www.kamooki.ca  From the videos, they do cool things when fishing bottom structure. Will see if it works in the hands of an amateur.
Those lures look promising!!!  Wish they came in a 3/8oz for walleye as well
Manitoubass2, Gord Pyzer uses a 5" 1/2 ounce swimbait for Walleyes.  This lure is smaller than that.  Those Kamooki's look sweet.
Those look deadly!!!!  And a decent write up. Thanks TDunn

I'm field staff for Kamooki Lures and have been using them through the ice on Simcoe for lakers. Even got a couple whiteys on it. They're working on a couple more sizes for this lure, one a little smaller and one a little bigger. Can't wait to throw them for bass! Great write-up by the way!
